abstracts.cdata!:
The Sixth Poverty Reduction Support
            Operation Credit provides further support to Vietnam's
            reform program. The current cycle of PRSCs is a vehicle for
            the Bank, and the donor community, to stay engaged with a
            client that has delivered an outstanding performance in
            terms o f economic growth and poverty reduction. The key
            priority action under the project are, 1) in the area of
            business development : decentralize investment ownership to
            better integrate capital and recurrent budgets in the road;
            clarify contract specifications, investor qualifications and
            treatment o f unsolicited proposals for
            Build-Operate-Transfer (BOT) projects; require public
            disclosure of financial statements of SOCBs in line with
            internationally accepted standards. 2) in the area of social
            inclusion : extend performance standards for primary
            teachers nationwide, including evidence-based assessments;
            adopt HIV/AIDS law and prepare action plans to scale up harm
            reduction, fight stigma and discrimination; unify legal
            framework to address gender disparities and increase
            women's participation in decision making. 3) in the
            areas of natural resources : issue strategy to strengthen
            linkages between protective and economic functions of
            forests, and promote local ownership. 4) in the areas of
            governance : allocate state capital expenditure
            transparently, using criteria like population, poverty and
            ethnicity; disclose results of audits conducted by the State
            Audit of Vietnam (SAV) and its annual audit plan; establish
            separate legal, judicial, economic, and budget committees to
            strengthen National Assembly's supervisory role;
            operationalize Steering Committee against corruption with
            power to suspend high level officials if suspected.
